title: Think San Francisco Housing Is Expensive? It Ranks 10th Globally.
text:
Former Speaker of the House Tip O’Neill’s famous observation that all politics is local applies to real estate as well. That’s clear from trends in residential properties in major cities around the world: Price increases have cooled overall, but costs have continued to soar in some already expensive places.

The most overpriced markets are in Europe, according to the UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, released Monday. Germany leads the list. Munich ranks as the most costly major city based on the bank’s criteria, while Frankfurt,...
description: Munich is the most expensive city in the world in terms of housing costs, according to UBS’s Global Real Estate Bubble Index.
